alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 2:40PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN DALE AND NORTHEASTERN COFFEE COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM CDT... At 239 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Clio to near Fort Novosel. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Fort Novosel, Enterprise, Ozark, Level Plains, Newton, New Brockton, Ariton, Pinckard, Mixons Crossroads, Hunt Field, Waterford, Hooper Stage Field, Clintonville, Ewell, Roeton, Dale County Lake, Camp Alaflo Bsa, Phillips Crossroads, and Hwy 231 Pea River Bridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
